body:
### Problem

When calling `vim.cmd.make()` (or `vim.cmd("make")`) from within the a function inside `vim.keymap.set`, the first line of the `:make` output is overwritten by the first line of the shell command output.  

This only happens when the `rhs` of `vim.keymap.set` is a function, and that function calls `vim.cmd.make()`.  It doesn't happen if the `rhs` is `:make<return>`, or the function calls `vim.api.nvim_input(":make<return>")`.

Notice that the first line of the ex-command output is overwritten by the shell command output:

```
GNU Make 4.4.1on  2>&1| tee /tmp/nvim.id/7znAGV/0                                                         
Built for x86_64-pc-linux-gnu                                                                             
Copyright (C) 1988-2023 Free Software Foundation, Inc.                                                    
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <https://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>                            
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.                                        
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.                                                     
                                                                                                          
(1 of 6): GNU Make 4.4.1                                                                                  
Press ENTER or type command to continue                                                                   
```

### Steps to reproduce

Evaluate the following snippet in `nvim --clean`:

```lua
vim.opt.makeprg = "make --version"
vim.keymap.set("n", "<space>", function() 
  vim.cmd.make()
end, {})
```

### Expected behavior

The command output should look this:

```
:!make --version  2>&1| tee /tmp/nvim.id/7znAGV/1                                                         
GNU Make 4.4.1                                                                                            
Built for x86_64-pc-linux-gnu                                                                             
Copyright (C) 1988-2023 Free Software Foundation, Inc.                                                    
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <https://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>                            
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.                                        
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.                                                     
                                                                                                          
(1 of 6): GNU Make 4.4.1                                                                                  
Press ENTER or type command to continue                                                                   
```

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.0-dev-1765+g906ad04ddd

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, completely different behaviour when displaying the command output.  Vim 9.1.

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux 6.13.2-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.39.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

AUR (neovim-git)

labels.description: UI messages, log messages, errors, warnings, feedback
labels.name: messages

title: First line of `:make` output overwritten by shell command output
